Remove variables from a data frame

Source: R/remove_vars.R
remove_var.Rd

This function removes variables from a data frame, and is intended to use within a pipe-workflow. remove_cols() is an alias for remove_var().

remove_var(x, ...)

remove_cols(x, ...)

Arguments

x

A vector or data frame.
...

Character vector with variable names, or unquoted names of variables that should be removed from the data frame. You may also use functions like : or tidyselect's select_helpers.

Value

x, with variables specified in ... removed.

Examples

mtcars %>% remove_var("disp", "cyl")
#> # A tibble: 32 x 9
#>      mpg    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb
#>  * <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  21     110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4
#>  2  21     110  3.9   2.88  17.0     0     1     4     4
#>  3  22.8    93  3.85  2.32  18.6     1     1     4     1
#>  4  21.4   110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1
#>  5  18.7   175  3.15  3.44  17.0     0     0     3     2
#>  6  18.1   105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1
#>  7  14.3   245  3.21  3.57  15.8     0     0     3     4
#>  8  24.4    62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2
#>  9  22.8    95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2
#> 10  19.2   123  3.92  3.44  18.3     1     0     4     4
#> # ... with 22 more rows
mtcars %>% remove_var(c("wt", "vs"))
#> # A tibble: 32 x 9
#>      mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat  qsec    am  gear  carb
#>  * <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  21       6  160    110  3.9   16.5     1     4     4
#>  2  21       6  160    110  3.9   17.0     1     4     4
#>  3  22.8     4  108     93  3.85  18.6     1     4     1
#>  4  21.4     6  258    110  3.08  19.4     0     3     1
#>  5  18.7     8  360    175  3.15  17.0     0     3     2
#>  6  18.1     6  225    105  2.76  20.2     0     3     1
#>  7  14.3     8  360    245  3.21  15.8     0     3     4
#>  8  24.4     4  147.    62  3.69  20       0     4     2
#>  9  22.8     4  141.    95  3.92  22.9     0     4     2
#> 10  19.2     6  168.   123  3.92  18.3     0     4     4
#> # ... with 22 more rows
mtcars %>% remove_var(drat:am)
#> # A tibble: 32 x 6
#>      mpg   cyl  disp    hp  gear  carb
#>  * <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  21       6  160    110     4     4
#>  2  21       6  160    110     4     4
#>  3  22.8     4  108     93     4     1
#>  4  21.4     6  258    110     3     1
#>  5  18.7     8  360    175     3     2
#>  6  18.1     6  225    105     3     1
#>  7  14.3     8  360    245     3     4
#>  8  24.4     4  147.    62     4     2
#>  9  22.8     4  141.    95     4     2
#> 10  19.2     6  168.   123     4     4
#> # ... with 22 more rows
